textList.name: START_BEACON_ZOLTAN
textList.text: You've entered Zoltan territory. This species is not renowned for giving anything for nothing, but you can always be assured a fair hearing.
The Zoltan patrol their borders but let you pass when you ID as Federation. Let's hope they won't be so courteous to the Rebels.
You arrive in Zoltan space. From what you have heard they anticipated the coming war and made preparations to hold their borders.
You're far from Federation home space here in Zoltan territory, and it's not clear whether the authorities will have any goodwill remaining. Still, you have to push forward.

You've arrived in a Zoltan sector. These energy filled humanoids are sometimes too fair, but don't even think that won't apply to you. Here, you have the same rights as other races, despite belonging to the Federation.
You've arrived in a Zoltan sector. You can be assured you'll find high-tech weaponry in their stores. And maybe you'll be destroyed by this very weaponry...
The inscription on the beacon at the entrance to this Zoltan sector reads: "Long live the Zoltan court, the most humane court in the Galaxy!"
Judging by the border guards who met you at this sector's entrance, the Zoltans don't intend to give up just like that, even if there are too few of them to detain the Rebels for long.
The Zoltan sector is always distinguished by exemplary order and strict enforcement of laws. But with the advent of the Rebels, much will change here...
Remember, the main thing for Zoltans is the law and the way it is observed. If you follow their rules, perhaps you'll fly through the sector without any additional "adventures".
Whether you will be met peacefully by the Zoltan or you will be shot at — it depends only on you. But be aware that because of the war, the borders of their sector are vigilanty guarded...

textList.name: STORE_ZOLTAN
textList.text: The Zoltan are fascinated by other species, and have set up something of an alien knick-knack shop here. Why not take a look?
A human ship hails: "My friends! Please, there is nothing I don't have, and there is nothing worth wanting that I can't get. Why not make yourself at home and take a look around my shop?"
A Mantis crew here has hunkered down in the abdomen of a long-dead space-whale - the only way, presumably, for them to operate their black-market trade without detection. Worth a look?

textList.name: NOTHING_ZOLTAN
textList.text: There are some mineral-rich asteroids here that the Zoltan have left idle, but you've none of the necessary equipment to mine them.
You have to admit - Zoltan space is a beautiful and peaceful place indeed. However, re-engaging the FTL and finishing your mission is your priority, not sight-seeing.
A light asteroid field is entering the atmosphere of a nearby planet - a fireworks show on a galactic scale. There's little for it but to take in the ambience and program the next jump.
You stumble upon some Zoltan military vessels engaging in combat training. Their Energy Shields are impressive, but you note how quickly beam and ion weaponry take them down.
You don't have time to hail the Zoltan ship that was waiting at this beacon before it jumps away. They are a careful race.
A Zoltan shipyard is stationed at this beacon. You admire the display of hundreds of glowing Zoltan performing delicate exterior work on a massive transport ship.
A message broadcast from a nearby planet announces the presence of an ancient Zoltan monastery available for visiting. Likely just a tourist trap, but still too bad you don't have the time to visit.

event.name: ZOLTAN_DISTRESS_MANTIS
event.text: Your jump interrupts a Zoltan security ship as it follows a Mantis pirate into an asteroid field. They message you, "Your presence here will continue to be tolerated - but please, do not interfere."

choice.text: Interfere and save the Mantis ship.

event.text: Sometimes you have to bet on the underdog - even on the rare occasions that the underdog is a Mantis warship. You set off for the heart of the asteroid field and engage the Zoltan there.

choice.text: Interfere and help the Zoltan ship.

event.text: You overtake the Zoltan and catch up with the Mantis ship in the asteroid belt. Time to make some friends.
The Zoltan know their business better than most — best to leave them to it. You prepare to jump.

event.name: ZOLTAN_DISTRESS_SHELL
event.text: You arrive to find a lumbering Zoltan freighter with no one at the helm. It's a mystery what happened to the crew, but it'd be a shame to let the opportunity go to waste.

event.name: ZOLTAN_TRADE_HUB
event.text: You come to a Zoltan trade and supply hub — everything the weary traveler needs, provided they have the right documentation.

choice.text: Try to talk your way in.
(Teleporter) Beam directly to the civilian deck.

event.text: You re-materialize in a dark corner of the main concourse and are able to conduct your investigations in peace.

choice.text: (Zoltan Crewmember) Present their official documentation and pay the entry fee.

event.text: They scan ID that declares your crewmember an official citizen, collect their fee, and let you pass.
You don't have the papers - well, the neuro-laced identity bracelets - to get in, so best not to try.
They don't see many of your species in these parts, and you stick out like a Casvagarian Sea Slug in a Plutonian Shrimp Stew. You make it back to the ship with a gang of Zoltan guards in tow!
You pose as traders and succeed in bypassing airlock security — however, it's only a matter of time before someone realizes your ID cards are counterfeit!
You head into a ship supply store. It is a well-equipped, self-service affair. An order is dialled into a terminal, scrap is deposited, and the item is dispatched from a nearby chute.
You head into the cantina for gossip. Topics of conversation in the cantina range from crop distribution microbes to the joys of Slug pleasure cruises.
You overhear one group discussing a newly discovered planet yet to have first contact, and note down its location.

event.name: ZOLTAN_QUEST_PRIMITIVES
event.text: You arrive at the primitive planet that you heard about at the cantina and are surprised to see a Zoltan ship facing off against a Rebel assault craft.

You tap into their frequency and hear the Rebel captain yelling, "We are liberating this planet in the name of the new Galactic government! These aliens will not be left in ignorance where they cannot be of use!"

choice.text: Interfere — make first contact with the primitive aliens.

event.text: The local people - furry, one-eyed tree lizard things - begin chanting when they see you. Suddenly the sky is lit by laser fire — the Zoltan opened fire on your ship! You dash back to the shuttle and join the fight.

choice.text: Protect the aliens' way of life — Attack the Rebel ship.

event.text: These creatures should be left to develop at their own pace. You direct all weapons on the Rebel ship and begin the firing sequence.
You don't want to alert the Rebels of your presence and you don't want to anger the Zoltan in their territory. The best solution is to leave.

event.name: ZOLTAN_FREE_AUGMENT
event.text: A Zoltan academy sits docked just outside the beacon perimeter. They're happy to show you the fruits of their labor, and offer something to take home with you.

event.name: ZOLTAN_FREE_MAP
event.text: The Zoltan stationed near this beacon are happy to receive you. As they give you the formal tour of their ship you spy some local star charts and mentally log the details.

event.name: ZOLTAN_ODD_MOON
event.text: Something strikes you as odd about a moon in the distance.
You try not to fixate on the moon in the aft scanner as you set the coordinates for the next jump.

choice.text: (Boarding Drone) Send a drone to probe the surface.

event.text: Initial scans indicate a network of caves not far underground. You launch a boarding drone and it breaks through the surface into the cavern below.

Your drone discovers a vast cave network and evidence of excavation. Buried deep below you find a Zoltan scientist, still hard at work. He tells you that all his colleagues are long dead. You decide not to ask questions and offer to let him join your crew.
A closer inspection reveals signs of habitation on the surface, but nothing else particularly interesting.
Sending a shuttle to explore a beckoning cave system you discover signs of a battle — and a still-functioning weapon!
A deep scan of the surface reveals a cave system that runs for miles, and what looks like a scrap heap left over from some heavy-duty construction.
It looks as if a team could break through the fragile layer of the moon's surface into a hidden cavern.

choice.text: Attempt to detonate some explosives to break through the surface.
Explosives are too valuable to waste on excavation work. Let's get out of here.

event.text: A portion of the surface layer is destroyed in an impressive display, revealing miles of caves. You don't have time to fully explore them, but you find some remains of an old subterranean base that could be useful.
The explosives are set remotely, but the detonation achieves nothing. What a waste.

Your explosives reveal the 'cave' is actually a secret base, located in a network of bunkers just under the surface. Everyone inside is dead; some Mantis clearly came through here recently. It looks like the Zoltan were researching advanced ship weaponry. You take one of their better examples back to your ship.

textList.name: ZOLTAN_FIGHT
textList.text: A Zoltan ship makes contact. "The nature of the day is rotational. The fever is emaciated. The reason is-" They've caught some nasty deep space dementia. Before you can consider finding help for them, they open fire.
You're surprised when a stationary Zoltan ship opens fire. It appears there are aggressive pugilists even among the 'enlightened'.
You receive a message, "This area is off limits. Submit your ship to processing." It's only one guard ship in a lonely beacon. You decide to fight your way out.

You discover a number of Zoltan civilian ships fighting off pirates. Unfortunately one ship mistakes your purpose and moves in to attack! They are refusing all communication; you have no choice but to fight.
Like many areas in Zoltan space, the residents of this sector prepared well for Galactic war. The military here seem to have given up reasoning with foreigners, preferring instead to attack on sight!

A Zoltan ship is waiting at this beacon. They request your identification, but radiation from the sun in this system is disrupting your communications. They take your silence for aggression and move in to attack.
The Zoltan ship patrolling this area hails you: "This area is off limits. Secrecy is vital." They power their weapons.

textList.name: ZOLTAN_PIRATE
textList.text: "Emergency, all ships in range, we are under attack!" The frequency matches a nearby Zoltan ship; you move in on their pursuer. They take your intervention as a cue to jump away. Cowards.
You jump just in time to witness a Zoltan ship's FTL drive overload. In their final moments they implore you not to get involved, but it's too late - their attacker is already upon you!
Despite their precautions, pirates have begun to harass the local Zoltan settlements across this sector. One such pirate spots your ship and moves in to attack.
A ship with pirate markings demand that you surrender. These are sad times when even Zoltan space is beset by pirates. You doubt these fools will be missed.
You spot a pirate ship looting a small Zoltan cruiser. They spot you and move in to attack before your FTL drive has a chance to recharge.

event.name: ZOLTAN_MANTIS
event.text: You pick up the last broadcast from a rupturing Zoltan freighter: "The Mantis, they're here, please-" You're interrupted by fire off the port bow!

event.name: ZOLTAN_ENGI
event.text: You jump into a debris field that used to be a Zoltan cruiser. Unfortunately, its Engi escort takes you for the attacker and retaliates! They refuse all hails.

event.name: ZOLTAN_ASTEROID
event.text: You arrive in an asteroid field and are greeted by a Zoltan guard, "By attempting to access these closed mining fields, you are in violation of the Natural Mineral Protection Act. Your weaponry will be confiscated for processing." You don't have time for this.

event.name: ZOLTAN_LIFERAFT
event.text: You pick up a Zoltan life raft floating in space. Its inhabitant asks you to retake his ship from the pirates who recently commandeered it. "I'm certain it is clear," he concludes, "that it is necessary to neutralize them without smashing my vessel to smithereens."
You refuse to get his ship back, but still offer to drop him off at the next station. The Zoltan is displeased, but directs you to a nearby starbase just the same.
He responds haughtily, "You would presume I would work under your command after such a display of... prowess? No, I must decline."
He responds defeatedly, "I suppose I have nowhere else to go without a ship. I accept your offer."

event.name: ZOLTAN_SCIENCE_DOCK
event.text: What appears to be a Zoltan research ship requests permission to dock.
They leave without a word.
You allow them to approach... it was reckless of you: they open fire!

"We have been studying the relationships between the species and have determined that the 'Federation' still has potential to be a net positive for the galaxy. Please accept this gift to aid your journey."

event.name: ZOLTAN_RIFT_FIGHT
event.text: You come to a quiet part of Zoltan space and unexpectedly stumble upon an ancient Zoltan wise man who has managed to harness the power of a spatial rift, but seems to have been driven completely mad by the power. "Choose your doom," he demands. And why are you not surprised?
"You like a challenge. So be it!" Nearby, a wormhole forms and a confused, angry Mantis ship hurtles toward you!
"Do not be fooled, Federation, by a soft underbelly." You detect a wormhole opening up, and seconds later a Slug ship is attacking from the other direction!
"A hardened foe for a hardened veteran." You detect a wormhole opening up, and a Rock ship appears with guns blazing. It appears they were in combat when they were thrust across space-time.
The old Zoltan is quiet for a moment, and then whispers, "Are you sure? Well, so be it then." A huge wormhole opens, and from within it looms a Crystalline ship, prepared for war.

textList.name: ZOLTAN_RIFT_SUCCESS_1
textList.text: When he sees you have emerged victorious, the Zoltan wise man enters a rage. Rifts threaten to tear space apart until, instead, the Zoltan implodes, sending a blast wave of scrap and salvage dragged here from distant worlds in your direction.

textList.name: ZOLTAN_RIFT_SUCCESS_2
textList.text: When he sees you have emerged victorious, the Zoltan wise man enters a rage. A bright flash pierces the space nearby, and you suddenly find yourself near an empty beacon... As another surprise, you find a new crew member on board!

event.name: ZOLTAN_CREW_SCAN
event.text: You arrive at a Zoltan security checkpoint set up in a perimeter around the beacon. "Travelling vessel, you will submit to crew profiling to identify fugitives of the empire."

choice.text: You don't have time for such nonsense. Attack!

event.text: Expecting resistance, their Energy Shield is raised and ready for combat.

choice.text: (Slug Crewmember) Have your Slug talk them into letting you go.

event.text: You give the guards permission to dock with the ship, but before they come on board your crewmember slowly advances to meet them. As far as you can tell no words were exchanged, but the guards offer you some supplies and say the ship checks out. Best to not ask questions.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Make the guards believe they have already checked your crew today.

event.text: The captain of the guard appears on the vid screen "Back so soon friend! Well, no need to waste your time further. Here, take these spare fuel canisters and get on with your mission." Your ship is cleared to pass.
The Zoltan security staff board your ship and scan the crew's faces into a computer. After a few tense moments of uncertainty, having not found anything, they allow your ship to pass.

The Zoltan security staff board your ship and begin scanning the crew's faces into a computer. Suddenly alarms go off and the Zoltan leap on one of your crew! "This person is wanted on five charges of Utter Villainy! Surrender them to us!"
It's a tough call, but Zoltan law holds sway here. Besides, that one always seemed a bit shifty.

removeCrew.text: Unfortunately your crewmember was taken away unharmed so your Clone Bay was unable to retrieve them.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

You're not going to leave anyone behind. Instead, you pull away from the station with the enemy guards on board. Unfortunately, they are able to sabotage your weapon system in the chaos. It's time to leave!

event.name: NEBULA_ZOLTAN_ROCK
event.text: This nebula turns out to be the hiding place of a terrified rock crew taking refuge from the Zoltan border police. They don't seem prepared to risk your leaving with their co-ordinates, and open fire!

event.name: ZOLTAN_EYE
event.text: Near this beacon you find the Great Eye, transecting the cosmos. They say that it gives to each what they deserve...
Your mission is to save the Federation, not discover new wonders around the galaxy. You prepare to jump.

As you approach, an ancient alien voice speaks to you: "Your mission has brought you great battles, and great losses. This will help ease the pain." A few minutes later someone reports medical equipment has appeared on the ship!

As you approach, an ancient alien voice speaks to you: "Your mission has brought you great battles, and great losses. This will help ease the pain." A few minutes later someone reports repair equipment has appeared on the ship!

You approach the Eye and wait, but nothing happens. All of a sudden, a Zoltan ship comes out of an FTL jump near you and hail: "You will be eliminated for your illegal presence at this beacon." Battle Stations!
You cautiously approach the Eye. The Eye, whatever it is, must sense as much because the next thing you know out of nowhere a heap of scrap appears in your hold!

As you approach, a kaleidoscope of colors fills the viewscreen and one of your crew begins to age rapidly in reverse, eventually disappearing into nothingness. Let's hope they've transcended physical existence, and not just been forced out of it.

removeCrew.text: You check your Cloning Bay but it lies dormant. Whatever just happened to your crewmember must be irreversible.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

You approach the Eye and stare into it. Out of nowhere, you see an escape pod flying right at you. You give the order to catch and deliver it onto the ship. Its door mechanism looks intact, but you can barely see anything inside. You're about to open it when...
...the pod shifts, whirrs and comes alive. Out walks a being made completely out of crystals — and they want to join your crew!
Approaching the Eye, you peer into it. A bright beam momentarily connects your ship with the Eye, and a young Zoltan appears near the cockpit.

You approach the Great Eye, and suddenly it begins to glow with a green aura. Radiance starts to move your ship and forms a barrier around it. Much to your surprise, you realize that it is a Zoltan Shield! You thank fate and prepare for departure.
You approach the Great Eye, and it begins to glow bright red. At the same time the temperature starts to climb rapidly, and now your ship is ablaze! You've got to get out of here!

You turn the ship towards the Eye and instruct your crew to approach it. As soon as you move just a few meters, it suddenly shatters into a thousand pieces! A considerable portion of them get jammed in your ship's hull, turning your ship into a sieve.

The whole crew starts to gaze fixedly upon the Eye. Strangely, no one can take their eyes off of it. The hypnotic effect lasts rather long. By the time everyone comes to, you know that in that time, the Rebels must have caught up by a decent amount.

As soon as you get closer to the Eye, a powerful flash cuts through space towards the Rebel Fleet. Telepathically, the Eye gives you the understanding that your pursuers are now completely disorganized and will not catch up with you anytime soon.

You approach the Great Eye, but suddenly hear the sounds of a crew teleporting aboard your ship! It seems that the Eye was being used as bait for unsuspecting travelers like you. You prepare to fight back.

You approach the Great Eye and aim all your sensors on it. Suddenly, the Eye begin to vibrate — from it splits off a small splinter that starts flying in your direction. You give the order to charge your weapons, but the splinter changes shape and turns into a weapon! You pick it up and prepare to leave.

You approach the Great Eye, and it begins to glow with black light. Something strange begins to happen in your engine compartment — your fuel tanks strongly vibrate and heat up. Fearing an explosion, you give the order to drain part of the fuel. It seems that worked, and the Eye returns back to normal.

You fly up closer, and the Great Eye begins to shine with pure white light. This light covers your entire ship, and you are surprised to see all your hull damage disappear. You thank fate and set off towards the next beacon.

event.name: STORM_ZOLTAN_SUPPLY_CHOICE
event.text: You spy two pirate ships lurking in the nebula here. They remain unaware of your presence; you're able to get your scanners to at least identify their cargo: One is carrying the fuel supplies, the other the ammunition. They begin to drift away from each other in the storm.
You jet toward the pirate with the fuel supplies and engage (it would be best if you can leave the ship in one piece).
You jet toward the pirate with the ammunition and engage (it would be best if you can leave the ship in one piece).
Sometimes discretion is the better part of valor.

event.name: ZOLTAN_BOARDERS
event.text: There are few more zealous in their customs checks than the Zoltan. A team of border police beam on board. There's just a little confusion over your weapons licences, but things escalate rapidly from heated discussion to gunfire!

event.name: ZOLTAN_BOARDERS_MANTIS
event.text: The Mantis outcasts sometimes make the mistake of taking the Zoltan for easy game. A scout moves in to attack while a boarding party beams aboard from a nearby transport!

event.name: ZOLTAN_PEACE_QUEST
event.text: An unarmed Zoltan transport vessel is slowly making its way toward the beacon here. They hail: "This is a Zoltan peace envoy. We carry no weapons or shielding and rely on the mercy of others to communicate our message."
They continue. "We take your silence for interested contemplation." They talk at length about peace and harmony, but either it's beyond your simple mind or it's all nonsense.
They finish: "Please, spread the word of enlightenment to those that have not heard. Once you have, contact our brethren." They transmit coordinates of their so-called "brethren".
The galaxy is at war — there's no time for talk of peace. You leave their hails unanswered and charge the jump drive.
You charge your weapons — this is just too easy...
Just as you're preparing to attack you detect a nearby jump signature. A Zoltan defense ship comes to their aid!

event.name: ZOLTAN_PEACE_QUEST2
event.text: You arrive at the location specified by the peace-loving Zoltan, but the only thing nearby is a Rebel ship, closing in fast! "We've found you! You're not getting away this time!"
You power your weapons and prepare to fight.
They reluctantly open communications: "I can't imagine there's anything you could say that will save you. The rebellion must destroy those that are still loyal to the vanishing Federation."

choice.text: "Perhaps there could be a reconciliation of our ideals without war?"

event.text: "Our ideals are too different to be so easily reconciled. You think this could end any way but war?"

choice.text: The galaxy is huge — you can find a place for your ideals elsewhere without causing this destruction.

event.text: "No! We will not be consigned to the backwaters of space just because we don't fit into your 'Federation ideals'!" They charge.

choice.text: "True progress can only be achieved without bloodshed."

event.text: Suddenly all indications of the Rebel ship fade away and a Zoltan fleet appears around your ship. The captain of the ship you met previously materializes on your bridge.

choice.text: "Surrender. Your ultimate destruction is inevitable. We've left scores of Rebels destroyed in our wake."

event.text: They shut off communications and immediately engage.

choice.text: "Your Rebellion is causing millions of deaths. Your beliefs are dividing the galaxy. Unity is the only option!"

event.text: "The people of the weak Federation believe they are 'equal' to aliens. The sacrifice of BILLIONS of alien or human lives are justified if it means we reach our full potential!" They charge.

"Although your methods are crude and most certainly ineffective, it is clear you took our previous meeting to heart. If your ship represents the Federation's willingness to adapt we shall do what we can to aid in their fight. This technology should aid your quest."
event.unlockShip: A Zoltan cruiser has been unlocked and added to the hangar!

event.text: "Although your methods are crude and most certainly ineffective, it is clear you took our previous meeting to heart. If your ship represents the Federation's willingness to adapt we shall do what we can to aid in their fight. I will personally assist."
event.unlockShip: A Zoltan cruiser has been unlocked and added to the hangar!

textList.name: ZOLTAN_SURRENDER
textList.text: "Yes, yes, you've demonstrated your species' capacity for violence quite extensively, well done, we'll say nothing more. If we reward your efforts will you bother someone else?"
The enemy ship hails; the vidscreen shows their bridge showered in sparks from malfunctioning equipment - it's safe to assume they're trying to surrender. Accept their offer?

Communications report that the Zoltan are broadcasting on all frequencies. The captain appears on screen and says, "Yes, I am not surprised, your species hardly looks enlightened. Fine. Take what you wish."
The Zoltan captain hails and mutters something about the border patrol force catching up with you someday; you're more interested in his offer of surrender.
"We assumed that your species' intelligence was directly proportional to your brute strength. We yield."
"You have bested us. Now, if only your species' efforts were put to use improving the Galaxy rather than your military might..."

textList.name: ZOLTON_SURRENDER
textList.text: "Yes, yes, you've demonstrated your species' capacity for violence quite extensively, well done, we'll say nothing more. If we reward your efforts will you bother someone else?"
The enemy ship hails; the vidscreen shows their bridge showered in sparks from malfunctioning equipment - it's safe to assume they're trying to surrender. Accept their offer?

Communications report that the Zolton are broadcasting on all frequencies. The captain appears on screen and says, "Yes, I am not surprised, your species hardly looks enlightened. Fine. Take what you wish."
The Zolton captain hails and mutters something about the border patrol force catching up with you someday; you're more interested in his offer of surrender.
"We assumed that your species' intelligence was directly proportional to your brute strength. We yield."
"You have bested us. Now, if only your species' efforts were put to use improving the Galaxy rather than your military might..."

textList.name: START_BEACON_ZOLTON
textList.text: This sector belongs to the Zoltons — a once peaceful race whose political views differ from their fellow Zoltans. Now they've been involuntarily dragged into the war between the Federation and the Rebellion.
Zoltons are famous for their ability to create the most solid shield systems on their ships. If you don't violate their order, then perhaps they will help modernize your shields.
This sector was captured by a group of Zoltan separatists. After the coup they called themselves Zoltons and introduced a special order in the territories under their jurisdiction.
Zoltons — the best in the Galaxy when it comes to specializing in ion and beam weaponry. It's extremely dangerous to fight them without additional shield layers.
Nebula beacons play a key role in the navigation of this sector, so the Zoltons leave their drones there to protect against intruders.

textList.name: STORE_ZOLTON
textList.text: Near the beacon, an enterprising Zolton has put together a small store-station. After making sure you can be trusted, they give your ship access.
The nearby station offers a list of goods banned in this sector. Why the local Zoltons have not yet closed it down is a good quesion...
A trade platform nearby is broadcasting about its discounts and new products. You fly closer with curiousity. The Zolton store owner assures you that all equipment is absolutely legal.

textList.name: NOTHING_ZOLTON
textList.text: Away from the beacon, you notice a small cluster of Zolton ships. But before you even get the chance to stabilise all the ship's systems, they're gone without a trace.
You exit the FTL jump near the beacon. With surprise, you notice that the beacon has its own small shield. It seems that the Zoltons sometimes go to extremes in their technical solutions...
You have to admit — Zolton territory is in fact quite a beautiful place. You admire the views outside the window while the FTL drive charges.
A Zolton ship is waiting for something at this beacon, but before you can greet them, they've left.
It's quite beautiful next to the beacon, but you don't have the opportunity to admire the local species — the Federation is in danger!

Several lasers flash by as they cut through the space near your ship. You notice how a group of Zoltons and pirates are making FTL jumps away from this beacon. It looks like you're a bit late for an armed local clash.

textList.name: ZOLTON_FIGHT
textList.text: You are met by a Zolton ship. They spin something about the need to pay for flying through this beacon. It just looks like they want to rob us, prepare to fight!
Usually Zoltons don't attack without a reason, but these ones claim that among your scrap there's illegal equipment. You don't agree to hand it over willingly.

A Zolton ship makes contact. "The nature of the day is rotational. The fever is emaciated. The reason is-" They've caught some nasty deep space dementia. Before you can consider finding help for them, they open fire.
For some reason, the oncoming Zolton ship thinks you're enemies. They indiscriminately attack you.

The normally peaceful Zoltons are acting rather strangely here. They walk in circles about their ship, periodically cycling power to random systems, and then point all their weapons at you! To battle!

textList.name: STORM_ZOLTON_FIGHT
textList.text: Zoltons thrive in ion storms. Seems you've disturbed one such ship that's studying the nature of this storm. Frustrated at the ruined experiment, they attack you!
Zolton ships are perfectly adapted to the conditions of ion storms. Feeling their superiority, one of these ships pompously demands tribute from you. Time to defend your honor!

An ion storm unexpectedly breaks out in this section of the nebula, and you lose control of the helm, which causes the ship to slightly scratch a Zolton ship at this beacon. A conflict emerges, which erupts into a battle!

textList.name: NEBULA_AUTO_ZOLTON_FIGHT
textList.text: A Zolton drone patrols this area of the nebula and automatically attacks any non-Zolton ship. Your ship is no exception.
A Zolton drone approaches your ship and, not finding any Zolton identification markings, enters combat mode. Battle stations!
Zolton automated vessels are programmed to destroy any alien ship, so strangers try to fly around the nebulae in Zolton territory. You should know that.
The beacon in this nebula is under the protection of a drone. As you're missing Zolton identification, it doesn't recognize you and immediately attacks.
Zolton nebula beacons are often protected by their drones. As it turns out, this beacon is no exception.

event.text: The ship explodes, leaving behind a bit of useful scrap.
The ship explodes, leaving behind some useful scrap.
The ship explodes, leaving behind some useful scrap.
The ship explodes, leaving behind some useful scrap.
The ship explodes, leaving behind a lot of useful scrap.
All that remains of this drone — a small pile of scrap and a unique Zolton weapon.

textList.name: CON_FIGHT
textList.text: You meet a smuggler craft, and they open fire without warning. Defensive maneuvers!
These smugglers are obviously carrying something illegal — barely seeing you, they activate their weapons.
Nobody likes to fight smugglers because of their disguised weaponry. But now you have no choice — they're attacking you!

event.text: You have important matters to attend to.

event.text: You've got better things to attend to.

event.name: ZOLTON_EYE
event.text: Near this beacon you find the Great Zolton Eye, transecting the cosmos. People know just as much about the Zolton Eye as its Zoltan counterpart — yeah, almost nothing...
Your mission is to save the Federation, not discover new wonders around the galaxy. You prepare to jump.

As you approach, an ancient alien voice speaks to you: "Your mission has brought you great battles, and great losses. This will help ease the pain." A few minutes later someone reports medical equipment has appeared on the ship!

As you approach, an ancient alien voice speaks to you: "Your mission has brought you great battles, and great losses. This will help ease the pain." A few minutes later someone reports repair equipment has appeared on the ship!

You approach the Eye and wait, but nothing happens. All of a sudden, a Zolton ship comes out of an FTL jump near you and hail: "You will be eliminated for your illegal presence at this beacon." Battle Stations!
You cautiously approach the Eye. The Eye, whatever it is, must sense as much because the next thing you know out of nowhere a heap of scrap appears in your hold!

As you approach, a kaleidoscope of colors fills the viewscreen and one of your crew begins to age rapidly in reverse, eventually disappearing into nothingness. Let's hope they've transcended physical existence, and not just been forced out of it.

removeCrew.text: You check your Cloning Bay but it lies dormant. Whatever just happened to your crewmember must be irreversible.

event.text: As your ship is solely under the control of AI, you need not fear the death of any crew.

You approach the Eye and stare into it. Out of nowhere, you see an escape pod flying right at you. You give the order to catch and deliver it onto the ship. Its door mechanism looks intact, but you can barely see anything inside. You're about to open it when...
...the pod shifts, whirrs and comes alive. Out walks a being made completely out of crystals — and they want to join your crew!
Approaching the Eye, you peer into it. A bright beam momentarily connects your ship with the Eye, and a young Zoltan appears near the cockpit.

You approach the Great Eye, and suddenly it begins to glow with a green aura. Radiance starts to move your ship and forms a barrier around it. Much to your surprise, you realize that it is a Zoltan Shield! You thank fate and prepare for departure.
You approach the Great Zolton Eye, and it begins to glow bright red. At the same time the temperature starts to climb rapidly, and now your ship is ablaze! You've got to get out of here!

You turn the ship towards the Eye and instruct your crew to approach it. As soon as you move just a few meters, it suddenly shatters into a thousand pieces! A considerable portion of them get jammed in your ship's hull, turning your ship into a sieve.

As soon as you get closer to the Eye, a powerful flash cuts through space towards the Rebel Fleet. Telepathically, the Eye gives you the understanding that your pursuers are now completely disorganized and will not catch up with you anytime soon.

You approach the Great Eye, but suddenly hear the sounds of a crew teleporting aboard your ship, as well as several explosions! It seems that the Eye was being used as bait for unsuspecting travelers like you. You prepare to fight back.

You approach the Great Zolton Eye and aim all your sensors on it. Suddenly, the Eye begin to vibrate — from it splits off a small splinter that starts flying in your direction. You give the order to charge your weapons, but the splinter changes shape and turns into a weapon! You pick it up and prepare to leave.

You give the order to charge your weapons, but the splinter changes shape and turns into a weapon! You pick it up and prepare to leave.

You approach the Great Eye, and it begins to glow with black light. Something strange begins to happen in your engine compartment — your fuel tanks strongly vibrate and heat up. Fearing an explosion, you give the order to drain part of the fuel. It seems that worked, and the Eye returns back to normal.

You fly up closer, and the Great Zolton Eye begins to shine with pure white light. This light covers your entire ship, and you are surprised to see all your hull damage disappear. You thank fate and set off towards the next beacon.
